topic.title: ZeroName Down ?
topic.body: My local copy of ZeroName is more than 2 days old now and I can see a lot of zeronet name updates in the blockchain. Is there something going on ?

topic.title: Orlando Gay Massacre
topic.body:
I'm gay. I have seen the news today. Please don't make this about restraining Freedom even more. Please don't make it about the L, the B, the T or the Q, or worse: about _women_. Don't make it about anything else than it is: male to male homophobia. There is no _better_ culture when it comes to male homophobia so don't make it about migrants either. Male homophobia is a guy's fear of his own attraction towards other guys. It's about what your prostate does to your brain. It's just that some males have the intelligence to deal with it beyond being _afraid_ of it. Male homophobia is _all_ about stupidity.

UPDATE 2016-06-15:  I have been on ZeroNet for a while. I know 99.99% of you guys are awkward virgin assholes that publicly pretend to be straight but exhibit typical homophobic closet confusion. Rings a bell ? _So_, I am just going to [drop this work in progress here](/tuetamere.bloccoq.bit/) to help you on your quest while I take care of my business on ZeroNet, trying to leave none of your narrow mind and even tighter ass unfucked. You know [who I am](/up4.bit/), should you ever need a little help from a special friend along the way.

topic.title: ZeroNet Talk in Montreal (Canada) on Monday July 11 2016
topic.body: Hi guys just so you know, I will give a talk in Montreal, Canada about ZeroNet and [libzeronet](/libzeronet.bit/). There is a [FB event](https://www.facebook.com/events/952775564841700/) and a [clearnet website](https://montreal.safenetwork.org/events/decentralized-web-meetup/). My talk will be in French, but this is otherwise a bilingual event.

1_1JKjdEGjhxQxn7jAUM9kcHAqDEFF5TpxGQ.body: If by "exchange of interest", you mean articulated opinions and not porn (which is aplenty), may I encourage you to create a ZeroSite (blog, maybe) and express what is on your mind ? It's going to be my pleasure (and others', I'm sure) to exchange ideas.

> [pzmw](#comment_7_1ALXyaQsvvCQ3R5WBrPbe4dXsqnLCLEkB7): I'm not gay, but…

You like sex with men (as per your own blog). I'm saying this because putting emphasis on you not being gay doesn't seem to me like a super nice way to say « hey you gay come to my place and let's talk ». And gee ! I'm sure gay people on your blog (and in your life) would do you no harm, on the contrary. ;-)

Pax

> [pzmw](#comment_8_1ALXyaQsvvCQ3R5WBrPbe4dXsqnLCLEkB7): Sorry, I didn't mean that to sound like a negative or offensive statement.

It sounded more like a challenge. Some people are put off by it. I find it exciting. Ha!

Pax

1_1BLPKyrF2D4ertte6JnAa6oWAMYzZGwKQz.body: yes, but I just verified and they had json syntax mistakes in them… i will update one of my own to check. and let you know. thanks!
my bad: I confirm that the json syntax errors were the cause of the non-updates.

> [ancap](#comment_41_1FYXQGLBeNabf5jZHgP4CwzbmJSKaK4oMz): I'm still curious about your theory about the connection between ZeroName and Namecoin blockchain updates!

if the domain's JSON value is malformed syntactically, it won't be added or updated to ZeroName

the JSON value can only be set by the domain's owner

> [ancap](#comment_43_1FYXQGLBeNabf5jZHgP4CwzbmJSKaK4oMz): Wouldn't it be ridiculous if it were possible that I make a malformed update to my Namecon domain and take ZeroName (and maybe a bunch of other .bit resolvers) down?

I understand and that is why I said that (afaik) the JSON value can only be set by the domain's owner. Hijacking /that/ is a Namecoin concern and not ZeroNet's.

I do get where you are coming from. I'm the one who insisted this centralisation of Namecoin resolution has to be publicly acknowledged as an issue : https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/407

However, I also understand that it is a difficult problem to solve, as are some other arguably more important ones: http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroblog.bit/?Post:71:in+progress:+comparing:+1.+ZeroNet+%3C-%3E+IPFS,+twister+--+2.+tor+%3C-%3E+i2p#comment_12_1QQggeZo72jptq7AvVQbrQKXZetKzF5kj

I was worried for a bit that there was a problem with the trusted zerosite that is used system-wide for Namecoin resolution and it happened not to be the case.

It doesn't matter why. My point precisely. You think no straight guy represses homoerotic feelings to the point of violence because of christianity or buddhism or hinduism or judaism or capitalism or socialism or ice hockey ? More than guns, more than God, more than women, more than money, more than power, assholes looooooooooooooooooooove closets.

> [assman](#comment_6_18AAv2MxpUxLjG6U64nucoBg833eTaR83u): You are dangerously wrong.

No. One of _us_ is. I think it's you. Moreover, before anything else, please tell me you like sex with dudes beyond your dubious nickname choice. Also, how about [this](http://www.latimes.com/nation/la-na-orlando-nightclub-shooting-20160613-snap-story.html)?

> [akratic](#comment_1_1JHEHUBioc6QPhP1jENXUNqY6mTqGKcEwe): But myself […] feel differently. Maybe […] very passionately.

Although I too wish you the best in finding the place you need to be right know, I, by virtue of you even needing to post this message ( and again, your _nickname_ ! ), feel obliged to tell you this: although it might have seem like me complaining about homophobia, this actually is me saying biology (the male prostate, the male brain) can't care less about what you (and I) feel, albeit _passionately_. Since the beginning of History, the invention of writing, heterosexuals in general and women in particular are failing at being part of this project that we call _Homo sapiens sapiens_. I wouldn't know how it feels to be on the wrong side of natural selection but homophobia sure is as good a name as any to call this sensation. The homophobia that has not killed me yet makes me even more of that abomination for you to be _afraid_ of, and for me to be _proud_ of. Get it ? 'Cause I think not. Someone that _fears_ me cannot be my friend.

> [lovelychian](#comment_1_1DD52vhXkbAdaS54PoZ2vNauiQ8XMiswC5): I am a lesbian

Even if you are, I'm what ? Less than 8/50 sorry for you ?

Also: 1) I am [not anonymous](/up4.bit/) and 2) I know _all_ about [霸王别姬](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Farewell_My_Concubine)

I will take it as a compliment. But, and this is not humility talking, I am much much much _worst_ than him. Or should I say _fabuloser_. And if you are not talking to me, I still say the same thing.

> [assman](#comment_8_18AAv2MxpUxLjG6U64nucoBg833eTaR83u): You all should also read _Islam and the Future of Tolerance_. Everyone, just watch _Islam Does Not Permit Homosexuality_.

Why ? When all you need to do is realize that, unless you are a muslim yourself, 100% of the homophobia you suffered, inflicted or directly witnessed was _not_ motivated by islamic ideology. As a white French Canadian catholic gay boy, I should know. I came out to myself 30 years ago. I'm 35 now.

Due to no sign of worthy interlocution whatsoever, this is my last entry to this thread. I'm off to the real world where so many young straight virgin yet gorgeous human male anuses are so eagerly (albeit unconsciously) yearning for my dick. Meanwhile, why don't _you_ sing along to [I Never Fuck](https://grruv.com/song-details/Never-F-Congorock-Remix/i313137145) ?

Don't fool yourselves, bitches, unless I breed your hairy man hole, we are not the same species. Extinction of your kin ? [Look at all the fucks I give](/tuetamere.bloccoq.bit/).

> Hitler was gay.

So were Turing, da Vinci, Gœthe, Mozart, Nietzsche, Vidal, Nash, Pasolini, Sade, Shakespeare, Byron, Wilde, Bacon, Aristotle, Plato, Saint-Laurent, Yeats, Socrates, Freud, Emerson, Lincoln, Michelangelo, Cæsar, Foucault, Tchaikovsky, Keynes, Proust, Gide, Rumi, Cantor, Genet, etc.. You know ? All the dudes past the highest degree of intelligence history will remember on a one-name basis. All of them. Clearly not the same species as you. So long and thanks for all the fish. Can't wait for natural selection to tear you apart before my very own very gay eyes. Or cum circle jerk with us.

I will go home on this and rethink my life, then.

Lol. Not a chance, snowflake. Suck on something and go back to Facebook.

So, yes. I think I will leave this thread as is now, since it totally proves my point. Give me your retard closeted virgin-ass cluelessness, I will reciprocate not with weak _civilized_ hashtag-love-wins shit, but with 100% pure experienced indestructible, uncensorable, distributed, encrypted, enlightened, deadly, gorgeous faggot filthy filth. _[All](/aurore2.bit/) [over](/penis.bloccoq.bit/) [your](/jnfptp.up4.bit/) [ZeroNets](/tuetamere.bloccoq.bit/)_. Homophobia _is_ a homoerotism. Capisce, bitches ?!!??!

Sit on it.

Back by popular demand. Lol. No really, I will get this because I think it brings something new to the situation…

> [scrub](#comment_110_1ADB7TdX2fVbTsWBoMe9yBTmVXTbb33b4R): I wasn't directing this towards anyone in particular

Do you mean you should have, then ? Because either you are saying my replies to death threats are inappropriately phrased _or_ that death threats are themselves the problem. Not both. So which is it ?

> all I'm saying is that everyone needs to calm down a bit and have a civilized conversation. It's getting childish.

Really ? That's what you'd say to someone pointing a gun at your face ? I think _that_'s childish.

 > Also, I read your update in the post and I can see you getting a little bit upset, and I can understand that.

I don't need your understanding. I wouldn't mind you clearly, explicitly stating on which of the 2 sides you are on, though. You can even explain and give a little background either way.

> The comments I am looking at is pretty disgusting.

Again, be precise: pro-gay comments are disgusting or (however subtle) anti-gay comments are disgusting?

> I expected a civilized conversation about this horrible incident, but all I am seeing now is anti-homosexual behaviour.

I _hope_ to see civilized conversations and people on ZeroNet. But given its radically nerdy nature and because of anonymity, I also expect to see a lot of sexually regressive and repressive behaviour. I'm the only one on this thread who is not afraid to reveal his [true identity](/up4.bit/). _This_ is telling. And I radically support these idiots' right to express their mental obsolescence to its full extent and to expose themselves for what they are: Darwin's rejects.

> [scrub](#comment_113_1ADB7TdX2fVbTsWBoMe9yBTmVXTbb33b4R) love doesn't hurt anybody, only hate does.

I disagree. It's tricky what ideas or ideals are referred to with this word "love". I know what sex is, though: it is the tropism, the motive that pulls human beings toward other human beings. It is our network protocol, a human TCP/IP over Ethernet. Sex, notably through rejection, through repression, through impossible desires and fantasies _is_ the most hurtful, tragic, destructive thing one will ever experience, _because_ it is also the most fulfilling and elevating.

>  I don't understand.

Let's see…

> Here here.

Well _this_ is where homophobia starts from. From an arbitrary sense of heightened morality that hides trouble. There is an Arcade Fire song that goes like this: 

_When they get excited, they try to hide it
Look at those normals go
When they get excited, they try to hide it
Look at those normals go
When they get excited, they try to hide it
Look at those normals go
When they get excited, they try to hide it... No!_

Some try to hide it with moral authority, some with boredom, some with disgust. All of this is homophobia, all of this is incapacity to deal with homoerotic arousal susceptibility. With women it is different, women exhibiting homophobia towards their own sons, husbands, boyfriends, lovers, coworkers was best been explored by Godard in his movie _Contempt_. But somehow I think spodermon, assman and al. are dudes. This is why they react exactly as it is expected of them here.

1_1PAo8TcX1nQGNtFRAKirp1uAoTt3btNdti.body: Who's going to be the censorship authority for this list? I'd say nay. If you visit a site you suspect of having such files, delete it. Only keep the sites you trust.

5_1GCMDNMgJHvZJfdbD9ygDmpBdnVAobdJYg.body: It will be exactly a month tomorrow since the last Github commit on the "reference" python implementation of the ZeroNet. I think it's time to start a new implementation in C with more robust internal IO (network, RAM, files) that should allow for larger files. I will need help. I need coders and testers. [Inbox me](/Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit/?to=up4) if you are interested.

> [testingzeronet12](#comment_41_1CMjV2r4EBpFt8VCcWWZKDysZXPcPExRNN): I am not sure what this means. Are you saying that they have stopped development of Zeronet?

I don't know. I don't even know if this is the longest streak without a commit. What it means is: I think the time has come for a fork that is interoperable with the reference implementation. Even if it is just a "safety" measure against what is currently a centralized development effort. Ask yourself these questions: what if (God forbid) something happens to nofish ? What if he gets bored ? How about trying different approaches and have the best one win organically ?

> [testingzeronet12](#comment_42_1CMjV2r4EBpFt8VCcWWZKDysZXPcPExRNN): I think nofish should accept more devs.

I for one think the devs capable of such thing should fork. I think nofish is doing a great job. He has his reasons. He did all this by himself. He can do whatever he wants. I think at least one fork is better than more devs at this point.

> I think in the DercentralisedWebSummit, nofish was asked what he wants for this project. he replied he wants more people to develop websites. He didn't say more developers for the technology. Having a single dev is a bit risky IMHO.

My motive for forking is that I feel limited with the technology applied to the [content I'm producing now](/bloccoq.bit/). And I agree with nofish that what ZeroNet needs _most_ is indeed disruptive content (all I'm seeing now is content about ZeroNet). And _then_, from the people producing this content, should come the technological direction. And since we are free to fork, I think it is very wise of nofish to say that.

> [testingzeronet12](#comment_44_1CMjV2r4EBpFt8VCcWWZKDysZXPcPExRNN): Btw I can't get your blog to work. It says something about Tor routers.

The message on [bloccoq.bit](/bloccoq.bit/) is a warning (in French) that says you have to have your Tor router setup properly so that your browser is able to resolve ".onion" addresses if you want to see the videos. If you click on one of the links fanning out of the cock's mouth, for instance [Nouveau vloggeur](/nouveauvloggeur.bloccoq.bit/), the second one, there are 2 videos on this page. Both are hosted on a Tor onion service. If an error message appears when you click on either one of those 2 videos, it means your Tor proxy is not setup correctly. If everything is OK, it should take around 30 seconds to connect to the remote Tor service and the video should play.

The reason why I want to explore basic I/O in a POSIX C fork is that it gives me hope to be able to host larger files within the ZeroNet site bundles themselves and not rely on a third party solution. As it stands, you can either use IPFS and lose anonymity or use Tor and lose decentralization. Both also require extra non-trivial setup steps.

6_178NSuZP2hH2vHhNX6vsHceh5sjPkDrLiH.body: Meanwhile, I have updated [libzeronet's status page](/libzeronet.bit/). I don't think IPFS should _merge_ with ZeroNet as both projects have very different objectives. I think ZeroNet should improve on its file sharing I/O performance. But it is a performance issue and not an architectural one. That is what I am working on with libzeronet.

> [fancypants](#comment_12_15k25aCTwyHfXnqtqpRvBbkDz5ka7gFuuU): I believe hosting content directly on zeronet could be dangerous and will very quickly fill up user hard drives.

Last time I checked IPFS storage safeguards & user control were even worst than ZeroNet's.

> I'm curious as to how you intend for content to be hosted, especially large files.

I'm focusing on performance (including larger file support) for now, yes.

But besides performance, I think that ZeroNet's site-file-optional-limit architecture is still the way to go for this. More control over storage should come from ZeroHello for site-level information and actions, from the site-loading progress page for larger site (I think the default limit per-site should be raised to something around 200MB and the site content storage limit upgrade/downgrade system can be improved upon for sure). For file-level control within a site, something can be done with the side-panel UI.

Also, it is important to stress out that the use case I am concerned about is original, independent content and not torrent-like archiving of commercial feature-length 10-bit 444 H.265 video with surround sound that was meant for the theatre. For that, IPFS is fine. Right now, ZeroNet is perfect for text and image content where every file is less than 1MB. I want to improve on the 1MB limit because I think video bloggers and artists with disruptive things to say have nowhere to go and ZeroNet only needs small (performance) adjustments to make them feel welcome. _That_ is what I want to work on. _This_ is the use case I want to support.

> [testingzeronet12](#comment_45_1CMjV2r4EBpFt8VCcWWZKDysZXPcPExRNN): Would it be possible to get these changes merge with ZeroNet?

If they benchmark advantageously against the Python stack, I don't see why not. Benchmarking is an important part of testing in this case. I will see with nofish & al. when I have something worthwhile.

> Better yet, would it be possible to make white-label versions of libzeronet so that organisations or groups of people can have their own versions of zeronet in a sort of world-wide secure intranet. Would it be feasible to add XAMPP support to your implementation of libzeronet?

I will not commit to anything else than the use case I have explained below for now. Eventually, I will make a public Github directory and it will evolve from there with everything this entails.

3_1BLPKyrF2D4ertte6JnAa6oWAMYzZGwKQz.body:
> [p2p](#comment_181_13Z7XxTa7JuFat3KzzMWu3onwM6biLuurJ): i hope that

I know there are some montrealers in here. This is the first ZeroNet meetup this side of the border. _I hope some people will show up_.

I will talk about the difference between anonymous infrastructure (good thing to me) and anonymous authorship (bad thing in my book). I _hope_ I will see real faces and real people.

> there will be a video of it

Yes, but you know me, it'll certainly be laced with misogynist-heterophobic-gay propaganda and other unsightly (if not downright illegal) things. Consider yourself warned.

I think ZeroNet is the publishing platform [_le divin marquis_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marquis_de_Sade) would have endorsed should he had lived in our times.

> and subtitle of english

Anything else ? I think if I manage to do a presentation _and_ record it, I'm doing my fair share. I _hope_ someone whose mother tongue is English and that can also understand _Quebecois_ will fire up [Ægisub](http://www.aegisub.org) on _all_ of my videos and send me a completed .ASS file for each of them. Like, _yesterday_. [Inbox me first](/Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit/?to=up4) 'cause I have subtitled some of them already. In exchange, I will remux the MP4s with the subs, make the javascript code and language toggle UI necessary to make _ALL_ my ZeroNet microsites bilingual. Deal ? You tell me when _that_ will happen.

Seriously, I'm flattered that you ask. And I thank you for that. But I think you should pressure the rest of the community to make the translation. That's all.

On Facebook, around 30 people have manifested interest as of now.

I'm not on Reddit. Go ahead if you want to post it there.

> [neonet](#comment_9_15ATNsS6aHGvBg5xoMP94sXpNaLX4fSHjN): I'm not sure myself if we would want this, but I'll leave this topic up for discussion.

I've been on ZeroNet for ~9 months now and I have NEVER seen child porn nor gore. Am I accidentally seeding it now without being aware of it ? Maybe. But: 1) If I am ever accused of childporn-related crimes because of this, I am perfectly willing to challenge the broken Law that allowed for my being tried in court in the first place. 2) If you are actually seeding illegal content, no interactive feature can protect you from a broken Law, by definition.

So: it's a good idea to leave this thread open (I wouldn't want you to censor yourself anyways) because the people that vote _for_ this are against the very ideas that motivate ZeroNet. People that are for this are _against_ free speech, _ontologically_. And I want to see _how many_ there are and _who_ they are.

> [neonet](#comment_10_15ATNsS6aHGvBg5xoMP94sXpNaLX4fSHjN): Does that sound reasonable to you?

No, if someone is too stupid to manage her seeding list according to her static sclerosed bigoted values, then they should stick to [www.disney.com](http://www.disney.com).

No. You proposal requires to maintain a history of visited then deleted sites, which in the case of child pornography is enough to get you indicted. I doesn't improve anything **and** it _does_ make it worst.

> [neonet](#comment_15_15ATNsS6aHGvBg5xoMP94sXpNaLX4fSHjN): @up4 Noticed a bit late that you're the guy behind libzeronet.

Yes indeed I am. And one of my goals with it is to strengthen the censorship-free aspects of Zeronet. I want to actually _help_ artists and authors that need a place for their voice to even exist. Because there _are_ voices that cannot exist on the commercial centralized web today. And to me and those people, cohabitation with hate speech, child porn and any illegal or criminal content is an _infinitesimal_ price to pay compared to not even be able to (again) _exist_ otherwise in what we dare call a _free country_. I'm not even sorry for those triggered or offended by my and other's existential albeit aggressive will to foster and protect _to death_ freedoms of conscience and speech.

I want to see features for _more_ disruptive content. Not _less_ of it. I'm _extremely_ annoyed with Zeronet being almost exclusively _about_ Zeronet.

> I wish you good luck with the talk you're going to give at Decentralized Web Meetup

Thanks. Because of this thread, I will reduce the technical portion of my talk and put more time into the philosophical part of it. If IPFS can self-destruct, it can happen anytime to ZeroNet too (and I see people pushing that agenda here _all the time_).

> [testingzeronet12](#comment_50_1CMjV2r4EBpFt8VCcWWZKDysZXPcPExRNN) I would not like to see it on ZeroNet or libZeroNet

I will do _everything_ in my power to prevent it too. It is not _at all_ negotiable nor when I think of it even _debatable_ anymore.

> [testingzeronet12](#comment_51_1CMjV2r4EBpFt8VCcWWZKDysZXPcPExRNN): A suggestion. Try to include anything which makes it easier for developers to contribute to ZeroNet development.

It's in C and requires a POSIX-compliant OS, libuv and msgpack. I'm developing in Xcode under Mac OS X 10.11 and will write a Makefile only when I'm ready to deploy it on my FreeBSD and Linux boxes to seed my content. Unless you know those things, it is _not_ going to be easy. You will make it easier still by knowing the Tor Control Protocol, SOCKS and Python (because it's what the ZeroNet Sharing Protocol reference implementation is written into and it is not otherwise documented, heck, it doesn't even have an official name).

> I don't know, perhaps breaking it down into simple steps etc. It's upto you.

I'm still reverse engineering the handshake (between peer nodes), if you want to help with that or anything else, [inbox me](/up4.bit/). Until I feel like it, I will only share source code with co-developers and binaries with testers (but I'm not there yet).

> Btw is the talk going to be live-streamed and on which website?

It's not. I'm filming it but I won't publish the integrality of it, only the parts that coherently follow-up on [these](/nouveauvloggeur.bloccoq.bit/) where I'm talking about what I've been doing that I can only publish on ZeroNet (once I've fixed the file size limit with libzeronet). And… it's in French.
